00048 static int suppress_pings;
00049 module_param(suppress_pings, int, 0644);
00050 MODULE_PARM_DESC(suppress_pings, "Suppress pings");
00051 
00052 struct mutex pinger_mutex;
00053 static struct list_head pinger_imports =
00054                 LIST_HEAD_INIT(pinger_imports);
00055 static struct list_head timeout_list =
00056                 LIST_HEAD_INIT(timeout_list);
00057 
00058 int ptlrpc_pinger_suppress_pings()
00059 {
00060         return suppress_pings;
00061 }
00062 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_pinger_suppress_pings);
00063 
00064 struct ptlrpc_request *
00065 ptlrpc_prep_ping(struct obd_import *imp)
00066 {
00067         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00068 
00069         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(imp, &RQF_OBD_PING,
00070                                         LUSTRE_OBD_VERSION, OBD_PING);
00071         if (req) {
00072                 ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00073                 req->rq_no_resend = req->rq_no_delay = 1;
00074         }
00075         return req;
00076 }
00077 
00078 int ptlrpc_obd_ping(struct obd_device *obd)
00079 {
00080         int rc;
00081         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00082         ENTRY;
00083 
00084         req = ptlrpc_prep_ping(obd->u.cli.cl_import);
00085         if (req == NULL)
00086                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00087 
00088         req->rq_send_state = LUSTRE_IMP_FULL;
00089 
00090         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00091 
00092         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00093 
00094         RETURN(rc);
00095 }
00096 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_obd_ping);
00097 
00098 static int ptlrpc_ping(struct obd_import *imp)
00099 {
00100         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00101         ENTRY;
00102 
00103         req = ptlrpc_prep_ping(imp);
00104         if (req == NULL) {
00105                 CERROR("OOM trying to ping %s->%s\n",
00106                        imp->imp_obd->obd_uuid.uuid,
00107                        obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd));
00108                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00109         }
00110 
00111         DEBUG_REQ(D_INFO, req, "pinging %s->%s",
00112                   imp->imp_obd->obd_uuid.uuid, obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd));
00113         ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
00114 
00115         RETURN(0);
00116 }
00117 
00118 static void ptlrpc_update_next_ping(struct obd_import *imp, int soon)
00119 {
00120 #ifdef ENABLE_PINGER
00121         int time = soon ? PING_INTERVAL_SHORT : PING_INTERVAL;
00122         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_DISCON) {
00123                 int dtime = max_t(int, CONNECTION_SWITCH_MIN,
00124                                   AT_OFF ? 0 :
00125                                   at_get(&imp->imp_at.iat_net_latency));
00126                 time = min(time, dtime);
00127         }
00128         imp->imp_next_ping = cfs_time_shift(time);
00129 #endif /* ENABLE_PINGER */
00130 }
00131 
00132 void ptlrpc_ping_import_soon(struct obd_import *imp)
00133 {
00134         imp->imp_next_ping = cfs_time_current();
00135 }
00136 
00137 static inline int imp_is_deactive(struct obd_import *imp)
00138 {
00139         return (imp->imp_deactive ||
00140                 OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_PTLRPC_IMP_DEACTIVE));
00141 }
00142 
00143 static inline int ptlrpc_next_reconnect(struct obd_import *imp)
00144 {
00145         if (imp->imp_server_timeout)
00146                 return cfs_time_shift(obd_timeout / 2);
00147         else
00148                 return cfs_time_shift(obd_timeout);
00149 }
00150 
00151 static cfs_duration_t pinger_check_timeout(cfs_time_t time)
00152 {
00153         struct timeout_item *item;
00154         cfs_time_t timeout = PING_INTERVAL;
00155 
00156         /* This list is sorted in increasing timeout order */
00157         mutex_lock(&pinger_mutex);
00158         list_for_each_entry(item, &timeout_list, ti_chain) {
00159                 int ti_timeout = item->ti_timeout;
00160                 if (timeout > ti_timeout)
00161                         timeout = ti_timeout;
00162                 break;
00163         }
00164         mutex_unlock(&pinger_mutex);
00165 
00166         return cfs_time_sub(cfs_time_add(time, cfs_time_seconds(timeout)),
00167                                          cfs_time_current());
00168 }
00169

00171 static bool ir_up;
00172 
00173 void ptlrpc_pinger_ir_up(void)
00174 {
00175         CDEBUG(D_HA, "IR up\n");
00176         ir_up = true;
00177 }
00178 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_pinger_ir_up);
00179 
00180 void ptlrpc_pinger_ir_down(void)
00181 {
00182         CDEBUG(D_HA, "IR down\n");
00183         ir_up = false;
00184 }
00185 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_pinger_ir_down);
00186 
00187 static void ptlrpc_pinger_process_import(struct obd_import *imp,
00188                                          unsigned long this_ping)
00189 {
00190         int level;
00191         int force;
00192         int force_next;
00193         int suppress;
00194 
00195         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00196 
00197         level = imp->imp_state;
00198         force = imp->imp_force_verify;
00199         force_next = imp->imp_force_next_verify;
00200         /*
00201          * This will be used below only if the import is "FULL".
00202          */
00203         suppress = ir_up && OCD_HAS_FLAG(&imp->imp_connect_data, PINGLESS);
00204 
00205         imp->imp_force_verify = 0;
00206 
00207         if (cfs_time_aftereq(imp->imp_next_ping - 5 * CFS_TICK, this_ping) &&
00208             !force) {
00209                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00210                 return;
00211         }
00212 
00213         imp->imp_force_next_verify = 0;
00214 
00215         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00216 
00217         CDEBUG(level == LUSTRE_IMP_FULL ? D_INFO : D_HA, "%s->%s: level %s/%u "
00218                "force %u force_next %u deactive %u pingable %u suppress %u\n",
00219                imp->imp_obd->obd_uuid.uuid, obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
00220                ptlrpc_import_state_name(level), level, force, force_next,
00221                imp->imp_deactive, imp->imp_pingable, suppress);
00222 
00223         if (level == LUSTRE_IMP_DISCON && !imp_is_deactive(imp)) {
00224                 /* wait for a while before trying recovery again */
00225                 imp->imp_next_ping = ptlrpc_next_reconnect(imp);
00226                 if (!imp->imp_no_pinger_recover)
00227                         ptlrpc_initiate_recovery(imp);
00228         } else if (level != LUSTRE_IMP_FULL ||
00229                    imp->imp_obd->obd_no_recov ||
00230                    imp_is_deactive(imp)) {
00231                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s->%s: not pinging (in recovery "
00232                        "or recovery disabled: %s)\n",
00233                        imp->imp_obd->obd_uuid.uuid, obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
00234                        ptlrpc_import_state_name(level));
00235                 if (force) {
00236                         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00237                         imp->imp_force_verify = 1;
00238                         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00239                 }
00240         } else if ((imp->imp_pingable && !suppress) || force_next || force) {
00241                 ptlrpc_ping(imp);
00242         }
00243 }
00244 
00245 static int ptlrpc_pinger_main(void *arg)
00246 {
00247         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread = (struct ptlrpc_thread *)arg;
00248         ENTRY;
00249 
00250         /* Record that the thread is running */
00251         thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_RUNNING);
00252         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
00253 
00254         /* And now, loop forever, pinging as needed. */
00255         while (1) {
00256                 cfs_time_t this_ping = cfs_time_current();
00257                 struct l_wait_info lwi;
00258                 cfs_duration_t time_to_next_wake;
00259                 struct timeout_item *item;
00260                 struct list_head *iter;
00261 
00262                 mutex_lock(&pinger_mutex);
00263                 list_for_each_entry(item, &timeout_list, ti_chain)
00264                         item->ti_cb(item, item->ti_cb_data);
00265 
00266                 list_for_each(iter, &pinger_imports) {
00267                         struct obd_import *imp = list_entry(iter,
00268                                                             struct obd_import,
00269                                                             imp_pinger_chain);
00270 
00271                         ptlrpc_pinger_process_import(imp, this_ping);
00272                         /* obd_timeout might have changed */
00273                         if (imp->imp_pingable && imp->imp_next_ping &&
00274                             cfs_time_after(imp->imp_next_ping,
00275                                            cfs_time_add(this_ping,
00276                                                         cfs_time_seconds(PING_INTERVAL))))
00277                                 ptlrpc_update_next_ping(imp, 0);
00278                 }
00279                 mutex_unlock(&pinger_mutex);
00280                 /* update memory usage info */
00281                 obd_update_maxusage();
00282 
00283                 /* Wait until the next ping time, or until we're stopped. */
00284                 time_to_next_wake = pinger_check_timeout(this_ping);
00285                 /* The ping sent by ptlrpc_send_rpc may get sent out
00286                    say .01 second after this.
00287                    ptlrpc_pinger_sending_on_import will then set the
00288                    next ping time to next_ping + .01 sec, which means
00289                    we will SKIP the next ping at next_ping, and the
00290                    ping will get sent 2 timeouts from now!  Beware. */
00291                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "next wakeup in "CFS_DURATION_T" ("
00292                        CFS_TIME_T")\n", time_to_next_wake,
00293                        cfs_time_add(this_ping,cfs_time_seconds(PING_INTERVAL)));
00294                 if (time_to_next_wake > 0) {
00295                         lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(max_t(cfs_duration_t,
00296                                                 time_to_next_wake,
00297                                                 cfs_time_seconds(1)),
00298                                           NULL, NULL);
00299                         l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
00300                                      thread_is_stopping(thread) ||
00301                                      thread_is_event(thread),
00302                                      &lwi);
00303                         if (thread_test_and_clear_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPING)) {
00304                                 EXIT;
00305                                 break;
00306                         } else {
00307                                 /* woken after adding import to reset timer */
00308                                 thread_test_and_clear_flags(thread, SVC_EVENT);
00309                         }
00310                 }
00311         }
00312 
00313         thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPED);
00314         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
00315 
00316         CDEBUG(D_NET, "pinger thread exiting, process %d\n", current_pid());
00317         return 0;
00318 }
00319 
00320 static struct ptlrpc_thread pinger_thread;
00321 
00322 int ptlrpc_start_pinger(void)
00323 {
00324         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
00325         struct task_struct *task;
00326         int rc;
00327 #ifndef ENABLE_PINGER
00328         return 0;
00329 #endif
00330         ENTRY;
00331 
00332         if (!thread_is_init(&pinger_thread) &&
00333             !thread_is_stopped(&pinger_thread))
00334                 RETURN(-EALREADY);
00335 
00336         init_waitqueue_head(&pinger_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00337 
00338         strcpy(pinger_thread.t_name, "ll_ping");
00339 
00340         task = kthread_run(ptlrpc_pinger_main, &pinger_thread,
00341                            pinger_thread.t_name);
00342         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
00343                 rc = PTR_ERR(task);
00344                 CERROR("cannot start pinger thread: rc = %d\n", rc);
00345                 RETURN(rc);
00346         }
00347 
00348         l_wait_event(pinger_thread.t_ctl_waitq,
00349                      thread_is_running(&pinger_thread), &lwi);
00350 
00351         if (suppress_pings)
00352                 CWARN("Pings will be suppressed at the request of the "
00353                       "administrator.  The configuration shall meet the "
00354                       "additional requirements described in the manual.  "
00355                       "(Search for the \"suppress_pings\" kernel module "
00356                       "parameter.)\n");
00357 
00358         RETURN(0);
00359 }
00360 
00361 int ptlrpc_pinger_remove_timeouts(void);
00362 
00363 int ptlrpc_stop_pinger(void)
00364 {
00365         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
00366 #ifndef ENABLE_PINGER
00367         return 0;
00368 #endif
00369         ENTRY;
00370 
00371         if (thread_is_init(&pinger_thread) ||
00372             thread_is_stopped(&pinger_thread))
00373                 RETURN(-EALREADY);
00374 
00375         ptlrpc_pinger_remove_timeouts();
00376 
00377         thread_set_flags(&pinger_thread, SVC_STOPPING);
00378         wake_up(&pinger_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00379 
00380         l_wait_event(pinger_thread.t_ctl_waitq,
00381                      thread_is_stopped(&pinger_thread), &lwi);
00382         RETURN(0);
00383 }
00384 
00385 void ptlrpc_pinger_sending_on_import(struct obd_import *imp)
00386 {
00387         ptlrpc_update_next_ping(imp, 0);
00388 }
00389 
00390 void ptlrpc_pinger_commit_expected(struct obd_import *imp)
00391 {
00392         ptlrpc_update_next_ping(imp, 1);
00393         assert_spin_locked(&imp->imp_lock);
00394         /*
00395          * Avoid reading stale imp_connect_data.  When not sure if pings are
00396          * expected or not on next connection, we assume they are not and force
00397          * one anyway to guarantee the chance of updating
00398          * imp_peer_committed_transno.
00399          */
00400         if (imp->imp_state != LUSTRE_IMP_FULL ||
00401             OCD_HAS_FLAG(&imp->imp_connect_data, PINGLESS))
00402                 imp->imp_force_next_verify = 1;
00403 }
00404 
00405 int ptlrpc_pinger_add_import(struct obd_import *imp)
00406 {
00407         ENTRY;
00408         if (!list_empty(&imp->imp_pinger_chain))
00409                 RETURN(-EALREADY);
00410 
00411         mutex_lock(&pinger_mutex);
00412         CDEBUG(D_HA, "adding pingable import %s->%s\n",
00413                imp->imp_obd->obd_uuid.uuid, obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd));
00414         /* if we add to pinger we want recovery on this import */
00415         imp->imp_obd->obd_no_recov = 0;
00416         ptlrpc_update_next_ping(imp, 0);
00417         /* XXX sort, blah blah */
00418         list_add_tail(&imp->imp_pinger_chain, &pinger_imports);
00419         class_import_get(imp);
00420 
00421         ptlrpc_pinger_wake_up();
00422         mutex_unlock(&pinger_mutex);
00423 
00424         RETURN(0);
00425 }
00426 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_pinger_add_import);
00427 
00428 int ptlrpc_pinger_del_import(struct obd_import *imp)
00429 {
00430         ENTRY;
00431 
00432         if (list_empty(&imp->imp_pinger_chain))
00433                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00434 
00435         mutex_lock(&pinger_mutex);
00436         list_del_init(&imp->imp_pinger_chain);
00437         CDEBUG(D_HA, "removing pingable import %s->%s\n",
00438                imp->imp_obd->obd_uuid.uuid, obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd));
00439         /* if we remove from pinger we don't want recovery on this import */
00440         imp->imp_obd->obd_no_recov = 1;
00441         class_import_put(imp);
00442         mutex_unlock(&pinger_mutex);
00443         RETURN(0);
00444 }
00445 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_pinger_del_import);
00446 
00451 static struct timeout_item *ptlrpc_new_timeout(int time,
00452                                                enum timeout_event event,
00453                                                timeout_cb_t cb, void *data)
00454 {
00455         struct timeout_item *ti;
00456 
00457         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(ti);
00458         if (!ti)
00459                 return(NULL);
00460 
00461         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ti->ti_obd_list);
00462         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ti->ti_chain);
00463         ti->ti_timeout = time;
00464         ti->ti_event = event;
00465         ti->ti_cb = cb;
00466         ti->ti_cb_data = data;
00467 
00468         return ti;
00469 }
00470 
00475 static struct timeout_item*
00476 ptlrpc_pinger_register_timeout(int time, enum timeout_event event,
00477                                timeout_cb_t cb, void *data)
00478 {
00479         struct timeout_item *item, *tmp;
00480 
00481         LASSERT(mutex_is_locked(&pinger_mutex));
00482 
00483         list_for_each_entry(item, &timeout_list, ti_chain)
00484                 if (item->ti_event == event)
00485                         goto out;
00486 
00487         item = ptlrpc_new_timeout(time, event, cb, data);
00488         if (item) {
00489                 list_for_each_entry_reverse(tmp, &timeout_list, ti_chain) {
00490                         if (tmp->ti_timeout < time) {
00491                                 list_add(&item->ti_chain, &tmp->ti_chain);
00492                                 goto out;
00493                         }
00494                 }
00495                 list_add(&item->ti_chain, &timeout_list);
00496         }
00497 out:
00498         return item;
00499 }
00500 
00501 /* Add a client_obd to the timeout event list, when timeout(@time)
00502  * happens, the callback(@cb) will be called.
00503  */
00504 int ptlrpc_add_timeout_client(int time, enum timeout_event event,
00505                               timeout_cb_t cb, void *data,
00506                               struct list_head *obd_list)
00507 {
00508         struct timeout_item *ti;
00509 
00510         mutex_lock(&pinger_mutex);
00511         ti = ptlrpc_pinger_register_timeout(time, event, cb, data);
00512         if (!ti) {
00513                 mutex_unlock(&pinger_mutex);
00514                 return (-EINVAL);
00515         }
00516         list_add(obd_list, &ti->ti_obd_list);
00517         mutex_unlock(&pinger_mutex);
00518         return 0;
00519 }
00520 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_add_timeout_client);
00521 
00522 int ptlrpc_del_timeout_client(struct list_head *obd_list,
00523                               enum timeout_event event)
00524 {
00525         struct timeout_item *ti = NULL, *item;
00526 
00527         if (list_empty(obd_list))
00528                 return 0;
00529         mutex_lock(&pinger_mutex);
00530         list_del_init(obd_list);
00535         list_for_each_entry(item, &timeout_list, ti_chain) {
00536                 if (item->ti_event == event) {
00537                         ti = item;
00538                         break;
00539                 }
00540         }
00541         LASSERTF(ti != NULL, "ti is NULL !\n");
00542         if (list_empty(&ti->ti_obd_list)) {
00543                 list_del(&ti->ti_chain);
00544                 OBD_FREE_PTR(ti);
00545         }
00546         mutex_unlock(&pinger_mutex);
00547         return 0;
00548 }
00549 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_del_timeout_client);
00550 
00551 int ptlrpc_pinger_remove_timeouts(void)
00552 {
00553         struct timeout_item *item, *tmp;
00554 
00555         mutex_lock(&pinger_mutex);
00556         list_for_each_entry_safe(item, tmp, &timeout_list, ti_chain) {
00557                 LASSERT(list_empty(&item->ti_obd_list));
00558                 list_del(&item->ti_chain);
00559                 OBD_FREE_PTR(item);
00560         }
00561         mutex_unlock(&pinger_mutex);
00562         return 0;
00563 }
00564 
00565 void ptlrpc_pinger_wake_up()
00566 {
00567 #ifdef ENABLE_PINGER
00568         thread_add_flags(&pinger_thread, SVC_EVENT);
00569         wake_up(&pinger_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00570 #endif
00571 }
00572 
00573 /* Ping evictor thread */
00574 #define PET_READY     1
00575 #define PET_TERMINATE 2
00576 
00577 static int               pet_refcount = 0;
00578 static int               pet_state;
00579 static wait_queue_head_t pet_waitq;
00580 static struct list_head  pet_list;
00581 static DEFINE_SPINLOCK(pet_lock);
00582 
00583 int ping_evictor_wake(struct obd_export *exp)
00584 {
00585         struct obd_device *obd;
00586 
00587         spin_lock(&pet_lock);
00588         if (pet_state != PET_READY) {
00589                 /* eventually the new obd will call here again. */
00590                 spin_unlock(&pet_lock);
00591                 return 1;
00592         }
00593 
00594         obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
00595         if (list_empty(&obd->obd_evict_list)) {
00596                 class_incref(obd, "evictor", obd);
00597                 list_add(&obd->obd_evict_list, &pet_list);
00598         }
00599         spin_unlock(&pet_lock);
00600 
00601         wake_up(&pet_waitq);
00602         return 0;
00603 }
00604 
00605 static int ping_evictor_main(void *arg)
00606 {
00607         struct obd_device *obd;
00608         struct obd_export *exp;
00609         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
00610         time_t expire_time;
00611         ENTRY;
00612 
00613         unshare_fs_struct();
00614 
00615         CDEBUG(D_HA, "Starting Ping Evictor\n");
00616         pet_state = PET_READY;
00617         while (1) {
00618                 l_wait_event(pet_waitq, (!list_empty(&pet_list)) ||
00619                             (pet_state == PET_TERMINATE), &lwi);
00620 
00621                 /* loop until all obd's will be removed */
00622                 if ((pet_state == PET_TERMINATE) && list_empty(&pet_list))
00623                         break;
00624 
00625                 /* we only get here if pet_exp != NULL, and the end of this
00626                  * loop is the only place which sets it NULL again, so lock
00627                  * is not strictly necessary. */
00628                 spin_lock(&pet_lock);
00629                 obd = list_entry(pet_list.next, struct obd_device,
00630                                  obd_evict_list);
00631                 spin_unlock(&pet_lock);
00632 
00633                 expire_time = cfs_time_current_sec() - PING_EVICT_TIMEOUT;
00634 
00635                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "evicting all exports of obd %s older than %ld\n",
00636                        obd->obd_name, expire_time);
00637 
00638                 /* Exports can't be deleted out of the list while we hold
00639                  * the obd lock (class_unlink_export), which means we can't
00640                  * lose the last ref on the export.  If they've already been
00641                  * removed from the list, we won't find them here. */
00642                 spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00643                 while (!list_empty(&obd->obd_exports_timed)) {
00644                         exp = list_entry(obd->obd_exports_timed.next,
00645                                          struct obd_export,
00646                                          exp_obd_chain_timed);
00647                         if (expire_time > exp->exp_last_request_time) {
00648                                 class_export_get(exp);
00649                                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00650                                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: haven't heard from client %s"
00651                                               " (at %s) in %ld seconds. I think"
00652                                               " it's dead, and I am evicting"
00653                                               " it. exp %p, cur %ld expire %ld"
00654                                               " last %ld\n",
00655                                               obd->obd_name,
00656                                               obd_uuid2str(&exp->exp_client_uuid),
00657                                               obd_export_nid2str(exp),
00658                                               (long)(cfs_time_current_sec() -
00659                                                      exp->exp_last_request_time),
00660                                               exp, (long)cfs_time_current_sec(),
00661                                               (long)expire_time,
00662                                               (long)exp->exp_last_request_time);
00663                                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "Last request was at %ld\n",
00664                                        exp->exp_last_request_time);
00665                                 class_fail_export(exp);
00666                                 class_export_put(exp);
00667                                 spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00668                         } else {
00669                                 /* List is sorted, so everyone below is ok */
00670                                 break;
00671                         }
00672                 }
00673                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00674 
00675                 spin_lock(&pet_lock);
00676                 list_del_init(&obd->obd_evict_list);
00677                 spin_unlock(&pet_lock);
00678 
00679                 class_decref(obd, "evictor", obd);
00680         }
00681         CDEBUG(D_HA, "Exiting Ping Evictor\n");
00682 
00683         RETURN(0);
00684 }
00685 
00686 void ping_evictor_start(void)
00687 {
00688         struct task_struct *task;
00689 
00690         if (++pet_refcount > 1)
00691                 return;
00692 
00693         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&pet_list);
00694         init_waitqueue_head(&pet_waitq);
00695 
00696         task = kthread_run(ping_evictor_main, NULL, "ll_evictor");
00697         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
00698                 pet_refcount--;
00699                 CERROR("Cannot start ping evictor thread: %ld\n",
00700                         PTR_ERR(task));
00701         }
00702 }
00703 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ping_evictor_start);
00704 
00705 void ping_evictor_stop(void)
00706 {
00707         if (--pet_refcount > 0)
00708                 return;
00709 
00710         pet_state = PET_TERMINATE;
00711         wake_up(&pet_waitq);
00712 }
00713 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ping_evictor_stop);
